physicalDescription.extent: 1 item (photograph), 5 x 4 inches, black and white
physicalDescription.note: Handwritten on back of photograph: ''Channah Milstein, grandmother? of Phil Milstein, member 'Glazierlach' clan of west-side Denver, Cotopaxi colonist, donor Mrs. Sylvan Moses.''

mods.abstract: Head and shoulders portrait of Mrs. Channah Milstein wearing a traditional kerchief or tichel headcovering. She was a member of the Jewish "Glazierlach" clan and a Cotopaxi colonist before moving to Denver's west side Orthodox Jewish Community. Channah Milstein was known for her personal commitment to charity in Denver's west-side East European immigrant Jewish community as she urged residents to contribute to her collections of food, clothing, and money for the needy.
mods.note: Appears in ''Images of America: Jewish Denver 1859-1940,'' by Dr. Jeanne Abrams, on page 75.
Donated by Mrs. Sylvan Moses who retained the original.
